results.title: Shadows
results.creator_credit: Cassavetes, McEndree, Cassel Productions, Maurice McEndree and John Cassavetes
results.brief_description: ‘Shadows’ was a vanguard work of the independent American cinema, a bittersweet comedy centred on three African-American outsiders - Lelia and his two jazz-musicians brothers living in Greenwich Village - two of whom pass for white and all are part of the late fifties ‘lost generation’. We follow Lelia through three brief romantic involvements. Although the film was recognised at the time for its treatment of race, Cassavetes saw this as incidental to the wider question of identity. His special commitment to expression through performance and a concomitant openness of form give his films a rough, uninflected, anecdotal quality (a form of ‘fictional cinema verite’). ‘Shadows’, like other Cassavetes’ films was fully scripted despite the reference in the end title to the film as ‘an improvisation’. Cast includes Lelia Goldoni, Ben Carruthers, Hugh Hurd.

results.title: Shadowlands
results.creator_credit: Spelling Films International, Richard Attenborough and Brian Eastman
results.brief_description:
Shadowlands is an absorbing and moving story of true love. British writer C. S. Lewis, whose comfortable but rigid life as an Oxford don in the 1950’s is shaken by his meeting with a forthright poet, American Joy Gresham. She knew him from his books and he remembered her from her letters, but when they finally met, she was unlike any-one he had ever known. Like his writings, his love for Joy is captivating and magical. A story for everyone, made with uncommon intelligence and restraint.
Cast includes: Anthony Hopkins, Debra Winger and Julian Fellowes

results.title: Shadow sister
results.brief_description: Shows the well-known aboriginal poet, Kath Walker, living on Stradbroke Island, Queensland; the very place which was once the home of her native tribe. She welcomes visitors - particularly aboriginal children - hoping to imbue them with pride in their own culture. Her charisma is clearly seen as she talks to the trees and plants.

results.title: Shadow Play [interactive]
results.brief_description: The discovery of fire not only banished the darkness and provided warmth to our ancestors, it also allowed them to shape their imagination by projecting shadows, which visitors can do at the entrance to The Story of the Moving Image.

constellations_primary.name: Shadow play
constellations_primary.description: Shadow play uses light and projection to tell stories – fundamentals that would evolve into cinematography. In the Wayang tradition, gunungan open and close performances and indicate scene changes and the puppets pass across the projection screen in a similar way to a wipe transition.

results.description:
The discovery of fire not only banished the darkness and provided warmth to our ancestors, it also allowed them to shape their imagination by projecting shadows.

Relive the origins of the moving image by casting your own shadow as it bends, towers and twists to craft imagined worlds, wonderous characters and incredible tales in this interactive experience that unites ancient storytelling techniques with modern technology.
description_for_label:
The discovery of fire not only banished the darkness and provided warmth to our ancestors, it also allowed them to shape their imagination by projecting shadows.

details.label: Curatorial section

results.title: Shadow play
results.creator_credit: Children's Library and Craft Movement, Arthur Cantrill and Corinne Cantrill
results.brief_description: Children are given guidance in cutting-out and preparing figures for a shadow play. Children learn to make Japanese style flat paper puppets, after being shown a play at their Creative Leisure Centre in Brisbane. After deciding upon a story to illustrate, each child draws and cuts out outlines, gluing on lace, and paper doily frilly finishes and painting black for maximum effect. Finally scenery is fixed to the cloth screen, sound effects and puppets tried out and a bright light shone on the screen ready for the performance of St George and the Dragon, narrated by an instructor.

results.title: Shadow panic
results.brief_description: I am the dreamer, the redhead. I search for hidden treasure: which fragment would yield gold, which memory would haunt forever? Three women, strangers to each other, yet their lives seem inexplicably linked. “Shadow Panic” is a short experimental film about internal and external states of emergency, about personal and collective shadows, about resistance and spirit.

results.title: Shadow on the reef. Turning turtle.
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, ABC-TV (Australia), National Geographic Society and Orana Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Blue wilderness”.
“Shadow on the reef” looks at the incredible Whale Shark, the world’s largest shark. Valerie and Ron Taylor explore the wonders of the deep below the coral reef, emphasising the message that this fragile ecology is increasingly under threat.
“Turning Turtle” sees Ron and Valerie Taylor at odds with the Queensland Government over the fate of turtles on coral islands, with a focus on Raine Island. The Green Turtles are a rare and ancient species and the fight to save them pits the Taylors against bureaucracy and harsh physical conditions.
